entry.title: Cross Examination | God's Blueprint of Salvation (Sermon)

media:group.media:title: Cross Examination | God's Blueprint of Salvation (Sermon)
media:group.media:description:
Church sermon produced by 3ABN with Ryan Day. The Bible Sanctuary is God's blueprint of salvation. In it are instruction that every Christian should know. God has laid the plans out for us so that we might have a way to escape the penalty we deserve, the penalty Jesus paid for us on the cross. Christ's atoning sacrifice was accomplished once and for all at the cross. Seventh-day Adventist have a unique view of the Bible Sanctuary you won't find anywhere else. Join Pastor Ryan Day as he opens the Bible to teach about the sanctuary from the word of God.
Don't forget to subscribe and click the bell so you get notified when we release the next video in this Worship Hour series.

entry.title: A Message Worth Sharing | Sabbath School Panel by 3ABN - Lesson 12 Q3 2020

media:group.media:title: A Message Worth Sharing | Sabbath School Panel by 3ABN - Lesson 12 Q3 2020
media:group.media:description:
Sabbath School panel discussion and insight by 3ABN pastors and teachers. This video follows 2020 quarter 3, lesson 12 of the adult Bible study guide book. This quarter's book topic is "Making Friends for God" and this week's Sabbath School lesson is titled “A Message Worth Sharing” Join us every week for fresh and relevant study of the word of God.
Reading: 2 Pet. 1:12, 16–21; Rev. 19:11–18; Rev. 14:14–20; Eccles. 12:13, 14; Rev. 14:6–12
Memory Text: “Then I saw another angel flying in the midst of heaven, having the everlasting gospel to preach to those who dwell on the earth—to every nation, tribe, tongue, and people—saying with a loud voice, ‘Fear God and give glory to Him, for the hour of His judgment has come; and worship Him who made heaven and earth, the sea and springs of water’ ” (Revelation 14:6, 7, NKJV).
(September 12 - September 18, 2020)
Sunday (Kenny Shelton) “Peter’s Present-Truth Message” Monday (Ryan Day) “Revelation’s End-Time Focus” Tuesday (John Lomacang) “Revelation’s End-Time Message” Wednesday (Jill Morikone) “Understanding God’s Message More Fully” Thursday (Jason Bradley) “God’s Final Appeal”

entry.title: Are You a Candidate for the Mark of the Beast | Sermon by John Dinzey

media:group.media:title: Are You a Candidate for the Mark of the Beast | Sermon by John Dinzey
media:group.media:description:
Church sermon produced by 3ABN with John Dinzey. There is two main characteristics of the people who get the seal of God written about in Revelation. They keep the commandments of God and have the testimony of Jesus. This group avoids the Mark of the Beast not by resisting it, but because they have God's seal.
The ten commandments and especially the Sabbath have a large role in Bible prophecy. These scriptures shows us that end time events will be extreme, but there is no need to fear. You can have peace if you follow Jesus. Join Pastor John Dinzey as he opens the Bible to teach from the word of God.
Don't forget to subscribe and click the bell so you get notified when we release the next video in this Worship Hour series.

entry.title: Sharing the Story of Jesus | Sabbath School Panel by 3ABN - Lesson 11 Q3 2020

media:group.media:title: Sharing the Story of Jesus | Sabbath School Panel by 3ABN - Lesson 11 Q3 2020
media:group.media:description:
Sabbath School panel discussion and insight by 3ABN pastors and teachers. This video follows 2020 quarter 3, lesson 11 of the adult Bible study guide book. This quarter's book topic is "Making Friends for God" and this week's Sabbath School lesson is titled “Sharing the Story of Jesus” Join us every week for fresh and relevant study of the word of God.
Reading: Eph. 2:1–10, 1 John 4:7–11, Mark 5:1–20, Heb. 10:19–22, Gal. 2:20, 1 Cor. 1:30.
Memory Text: “These things I have written to you who believe in the name of the Son of God, that you may know that you have eternal life, and that you may continue to believe in the name of the Son of God” (1 John 5:13, NKJV).
(September 5 - September 11, 2020)
Sunday (Ryan Day) “Jesus: The Basis of Our Testimony” Monday (Jill Morikone) “The Transformative Power of Personal Testimony” Tuesday (Danny Shelton) “Telling the Story of Jesus” Wednesday (John Lomacang) “Testifying With Assurance” Thursday (Kenny Shelton) “Something Worth Testifying About”
